intro: Denhamia megacarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited denhamia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, large, woody fruits that can reach up to 10 centimeters in length. Its flowers are typically small and white or pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces a fragrant, resinous sap. Denhamia megacarpa is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
